alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Iron; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:18AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Bayfield, west central Iron, southeastern Washburn, southwestern Ashland and Sawyer Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 117 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Namekagon, to Chippewa Flowage East, to near Birchwood, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Clam Lake and Namekagon around 125 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Exeland, Mellen and Radisson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
